duties_responsibilities.duty: Advise the Superintendent on technical matters and lead a mission-focused maintenance effort.
Manage assigned resources necessary to accomplish the mission and control maintenance through leads and seniors.
Enforce strict adherence to technical data and management procedures, adjusting resources to meet production requirements.
Initiate management actions to meet new workloads or correct reported/perceived deficiencies, ensuring compliance with safety directives and appropriate occupational safety standards.
Participate in the maintenance planning cycle, ensuring only qualified personnel accomplish maintenance with the appropriate equipment and tools.
Review and evaluate management and production effectiveness, analyzing personnel and equipment performance history using QA reports.
Ensure accurate daily documentation of maintenance actions and analyze personnel and equipment performance history using QA reports.
Advise the production supervisor of conditions that may disrupt the orderly and controlled execution of the maintenance plan.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or Management is preferred, or 5-8 years private sector or military experience directly related to contract performance or equivalent.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, organizational, and analytical skills are required.
Position may require travel and the ability to obtain/maintain any company/government required qualification, certification, licensing, or security clearance.
Must have a valid driver's license and be able to work any assigned shift or schedule.
